articles.headline: Walmart Stock Sinks After a Warning on Sales
articles.snippet: The retailer also said its heavy investment in wages and e-commerce would weigh on future earnings.
articles.abstract: The retailer also said its heavy investment in wages and e-commerce would weigh on future earnings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Walmart startled investors on Wednesday by slashing its sales forecast for the year, warning that heavy investments in wages and in e-commerce would curb future earnings.

articles.headline: India’s Manufacturing Sector Courts the World, but Pitfalls Remain
articles.snippet: An aggressive push to open factories in India reflects the increasing problems of doing business in China, but doing business in India is not much easier.
articles.abstract: An aggressive push to open factories in India reflects the increasing problems of doing business in China, but doing business in India is not much easier.
articles.lead_paragraph: PUNE, India — Play-Doh, Monopoly and practically all of Hasbro’s other toys were made in China for decades. Now Hasbro is changing course.

articles.headline: Sex Ed Lesson: ‘Yes Means Yes,’ but It’s Tricky
articles.snippet: California requires high schools to teach affirmative consent, defining when and how people agree to have sex, but critics say the lessons sow confusion.
articles.abstract: California requires high schools to teach affirmative consent, defining when and how people agree to have sex, but critics say the lessons sow confusion.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The classroom of 10th graders had already learned about sexually transmitted diseases and various types of birth control. On this day, the teenagers gathered around tables to discuss another topic: how and why to make sure each step in a sexual encounter is met with consent.

articles.headline: Square, the Mobile Payments Company, Discloses I.P.O. Plans
articles.snippet: The company — headed by Jack Dorsey, also Twitter’s chief — has aimed to reinvent payment processing for small and medium-size businesses.
articles.abstract: The company — headed by Jack Dorsey, also Twitter’s chief — has aimed to reinvent payment processing for small and medium-size businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jack Dorsey is about to get even busier.

articles.headline: Russian Military Uses Syria as Proving Ground, and West Takes Notice
articles.snippet: The operation in Syria — still relatively limited — has become, in effect, a testing ground for an increasingly confrontational and defiant Russia under Mr. Putin.
articles.abstract: The operation in Syria — still relatively limited — has become, in effect, a testing ground for an increasingly confrontational and defiant Russia under Mr. Putin.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two weeks of air and missile strikes in Syria have given Western intelligence and military officials a deeper appreciation of the transformation that Russia’s military has undergone under President Vladimir V. Putin, showcasing its ability to conduct operations beyond its borders and providing a public demonstration of new weaponry, tactics and strategy.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: VW Scandal Exposes Cozy Ties in Europe’s New Car Tests
articles.snippet: TÜV Nord, the company at the forefront of finding a new testing regimen for European automakers, is also the company that signed off on Volkswagen’s emissions tests.
articles.abstract: TÜV Nord, the company at the forefront of finding a new testing regimen for European automakers, is also the company that signed off on Volkswagen’s emissions tests.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Three diesel cars were taken out for a trial run last year by a German engineering and testing company. Employees at the company, TÜV Nord, drove the cars in Stuttgart and in Munich, and in suburbs, on country roads and on highways.
articles.byline: By Danny Hakim and Graham Bowley

articles.headline: Treasury Considers Plan to Help Puerto Rico
articles.snippet: Under the proposal, the federal government would help Puerto Rico collect taxes, which would be placed in a “lockbox.”
articles.abstract: Under the proposal, the federal government would help Puerto Rico collect taxes, which would be placed in a “lockbox.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Officials in the Treasury Department are discussing a radical and aggressive response to the fiscal chaos engulfing Puerto Rico that could involve a broad debt exchange assisted by the federal government.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Mary Williams Walsh

articles.headline: Voter ID Battle Shifts to Kansas
articles.snippet: A lawsuit challenges a rule requiring proof of citizenship that has left thousands of people — many of them young and first-time voters — listed as incomplete registrants.
articles.abstract: A lawsuit challenges a rule requiring proof of citizenship that has left thousands of people — many of them young and first-time voters — listed as incomplete registrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amelia Flores, a high school senior with plans to become an electrical engineer, eagerly filled out a form to register to vote for the first time at the Kansas State Fair last month. But she left the fair without registering, stymied by a state law championed by Republicans who dominate elected offices in Kansas that requires her to provide proof of citizenship.

articles.headline: Volkswagen to Recall 8.5 Million Vehicles in Europe
articles.snippet: After the government ordered the company to recall cars in Germany to fix deceptive software, Volkswagen expanded the effort to the entire European Union.
articles.abstract: After the government ordered the company to recall cars in Germany to fix deceptive software, Volkswagen expanded the effort to the entire European Union.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Reacting to pressure from German regulators, Volkswagen on Thursday recalled its entire fleet of rigged diesel cars in Europe, as the carmaker scrambles to come up with a remedy for its emissions cheating.

articles.headline: In Reversal, Obama Says U.S. Soldiers Will Stay in Afghanistan to 2017
articles.snippet: President Obama halted the withdrawal of forces from Afghanistan, announcing that the U.S. would keep thousands of troops there through the end of his term in 2017.
articles.abstract: President Obama halted the withdrawal of forces from Afghanistan, announcing that the U.S. would keep thousands of troops there through the end of his term in 2017.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama halted the withdrawal of American military forces from Afghanistan on Thursday, announcing that the United States will keep thousands of troops in the country through the end of his term in 2017 and indefinitely prolonging the American role in a war that has already lasted 14 years.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Slump in Trading Hurts Goldman Sachs Earnings
articles.snippet: The Wall Street company reported third-quarter declines in both revenue and profit that were sharper than expected.
articles.abstract: The Wall Street company reported third-quarter declines in both revenue and profit that were sharper than expected.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs is known for outperforming its competitors on Wall Street.
